title: Job 5:1
text: CALL now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?

title: Job 5:2
text: For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.

title: Job 5:3
text: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

title: Job 5:4
text: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.

title: Job 5:5
text: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.

title: Job 5:6
text: Although affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;

title: Job 5:7
text: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

title: Job 5:8
text: I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:

title: Job 5:9
text: Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:

title: Job 5:10
text: Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:

title: Job 5:11
text: To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.

title: Job 5:12
text: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.

title: Job 5:13
text: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.

title: Job 5:14
text: They meet with darkness in the daytime, and grope in the noonday as in the night.

title: Job 5:15
text: But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.

title: Job 5:16
text: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.

title: Job 5:17
text: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:

title: Job 5:18
text: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.

title: Job 5:19
text: He shall deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.

title: Job 5:20
text: In famine he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.

title: Job 5:21
text: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.

title: Job 5:22
text: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.

title: Job 5:23
text: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.

title: Job 5:24
text: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.

title: Job 5:25
text: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.

title: Job 5:26
text: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.

title: Job 5:27
text: Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
